page.title: 13LAND USE AROUND CHARING
page.content: In our 12 square kilometres, is the village of Charing, on the edge of the North Downs. The North Downs are mostly chalk and a few streams spring from them. There is a fairly large area of woodland and orchard around the village. The woodland is all deciduous, while the orchards are apple and pear. There are two villages in our area, the biggest being Charing,the smaller being Charing Heath. In Charing Heath there are two sandpits. In fact most of Charing Heath is built on sand, which affects the farming as the land drains easily. A railway runs through Charing and just outside Charing Heath, as does the A20 London\Dover road.
